column4: is this issue with network manager even recognized as a problem?
http://www.savvyadmin.com/2007/06/
yeh, except the libpam-keyring package is not available in gutsy... (well, it's listed, but it's a virtual package and doesn't actualy install anything)
why don't you read the whole thing first?
i did... it says that it is integrated into gutsy, but it's not working
then file a bug report
yes?
there have already been bug reports filed, and no solutions
then i guess you're sol
is this the bug report you were referring to: https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+question/16356
one of them, yes... but "common-pamkeyring" is not available in gutsy. this was a pam include file that came with libpam-keyring
it doesn't say anything about requiring common-pamkeyring, that i can see. i assume the solution that is given in the forum thread linked to in the bug report didn't work?
yes
and you've removed libpam-keyring?
removed it?
it is no longer required, and is in fact probably causing your difficulties
it's a virtual package and doesn't actually install anything
i would recommend trying a fresh install; i suspect your problem will vanish
it is a fresh install
and you don't get the check box to automatically unlock your keyring?
no
then you best file another bug report
nil, i suspect.
officially, of course. i'm sure it will be available in other repositories soon.
